intro: Pyrrocoma uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are adapted for pollination by insects, and its leaves are finely divided, resembling those of other members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
